alert.note: Alert for Clay; Knox; Laurel; Leslie (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 6:42PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Laurel, northeastern Knox, southwestern Leslie and southern Clay Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 642 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cranes Nest, or 9 miles north of Barbourville, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Haven, Woollum and Fount around 645 PM EDT. Jonsee, Cottongin, Park Valley, House and Hammond around 650 PM EDT. Ogle, Lipps, Botto, Goose Rock, Brightshade, Boho, Ice Cliff and Bluehole around 655 PM EDT. Plank, Ashers Fork and Hector around 700 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Marcum, Creekville, Spring Creek, Bear Branch, Big Creek, Peabody, Roark, Queendale, Skidmore, Bobs Fork and Essie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
